1.text: When the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome, bought spices in order to come and anoint him.

2.text: Very early on the first day of the week, they arrived at the tomb when the sun had risen.

3.text: They were saying among themselves, “Who will roll away the stone from the door of the tomb for us?”

4.text: But when they looked up, they saw that the stone was [already] rolled back, although it was extremely large.

5.text: Entering into the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, dressed in a white robe, and they were amazed.

6.text: He said to them, “Do not be amazed! You seek Jesus the Nazarene, who has been crucified. He has risen! He is not here! Behold, the place where they laid him!

7.text: But go, tell his disciples and Peter, ‘He goes before you into Galilee. There you will see him, as he told you.’”

8.text: They went out and fled from the tomb, for trembling and astonishment had come upon them. They said nothing to anyone because they were afraid.

9.text: Now after Jesus had risen early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.

10.text: She went and told [this to] those who had been with him, as they mourned and wept.

11.text: When they heard that Jesus was alive and had been seen by her, they disbelieved.

12.text: After these things, he was revealed in another form to two of them, as they walked, on their way into the country.

13.text: They went on their way and told it to the rest who did not believe them, either.

14.text: Afterward, Jesus was revealed to the eleven themselves as they sat at the table, and he rebuked them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they did not believe those who had seen him after he had risen.

15.text: He said to them, “Go into the whole world, and preach the Good News to the whole creation.

16.text: Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved; but whoever disbelieves will be condemned.

17.text: These signs will accompany those who believe: they will cast out demons in my Name; they will speak with new languages;

18.text: they will take up snakes; and if they drink any deadly thing, it will in no way hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover.”

19.text: And so, the Lord, after he had spoken to them, was received up into heaven and sat down at the right hand of God.

20.text: They went out and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them and confirming the word by the signs that accompanied [them]. Amen.
